raw_text:
Roddick to face Saulnier in final
 
 Andy Roddick will play Cyril Saulnier in the final of the SAP Open in San Jose on Sunday.
 
 The American top seed and defending champion overcame Germany's Tommy Haas, the third seed, 7-6 (7-3) 6-3. "I was feeling horrible earlier in the week," Roddick said. "I thought tonight was a step in the right direction." Saulnier battled to a 6-7 (3-7) 6-3 6-3 win over seventh seed Jurgen Melzer, who twisted his ankle early in the second set. Roddick won the last four points of the first-set tie-break before being broken at the start of the second set. But he broke straight back and then broke Haas again to lead 4-2. "It's extremely frustrating when you have chances against a top-five player and don't do anything with them," admitted Haas. "I rushed a few backhands and he took advantage." Saulnier will move into the world's top 50 for the first time after his passage through to the final. "It's taken a lot of work and a lot of fighting in my mind," he revealed. "Sometimes I didn't believe I could get to a final and now I am here. I've stayed mentally strong. "I'm on the way. I'll keep fighting and work a lot and I'll be up there."
llama3.2:1b:
Andy Roddick will play Cyril Saulnier in the SAP Open final in San Jose on Sunday after defeating Tommy Haas 7-6 (7-3) 6-3.

Roddick won the first set tie-break, but was broken at the start of the second set. He broke straight back and then broke Haas again to lead 4-2.

Haas rushed a few backhands in his third service break, allowing Roddick to take advantage for his fourth point.

Roddick overcame injury concerns to win, while Haas blamed his loss on rushing backhands. Saulnier, a seventh seed, won 6-7 (3-7) 6-3 6-3 after twisting an ankle, and will move into the world's top 50 for the first time.
gemma2:2b:
Andy Roddick defeated Tommy Haas to advance to the final of the SAP Open, where he will face Cyril Saulnier.  Saulnier earned his victory over Jurgen Melzer after battling back from a 2-set deficit. 
  
Roddick is now set to move into the world's top 50 and faces Saulnier in the final on Sunday.

qwen2.5:1.5b: Andy Roddick will face Cyril Saulnier in the final of the SAP Open in San Jose, after defeating Tommy Haas to reach the title match. Saulnier advances for his first top-50 ranking with a win over Jurgen Melzer.
qwen2.5:3b: Andy Roddick will play Cyril Saulnier in the final of SAP Open in San Jose, where Roddick defeated Tommy Haas 7-6 (7-3) 6-3. Saulnier, who won his semi-final over Jurgen Melzer, advances to world's top 50 for first time after tournament success.
opencoder:1.5b: "Roddick, when facing Saulnier in the SAP Open final, he experienced a thrilling match against Germany's Tommy Haas who also faced Jurgen Melzer in the second set. He scored 4-2 points and was overwhelmed by his defeat. Despite being criticized earlier in the week for feeling terrible, it is a testament to the resilience of players like him. Saulnier then moved into the world's top 50, proving himself to be a formidable contender."

I should identify the main points. The title mentions that Roddick will face Saulnier in the final. Both are top seeds, Roddick being American and Saulnier German. The match highlights how Roddick is a defending champion over Germany's Tommy Haas. 

The text also emphasizes how Roddick was down early but made progress through backhands and points. He faced a top-five player but managed to overcome his ankle issues. Saulier won the tie-break and has moved up significantly, entering the top-50.

I need to keep these key elements in the summary: who is facing whom, the scores, Roddick's feelings, the tough opponent Haas, the backhand advantage, Saulier's climb up, and his mental state after reaching the final. 

I should make sure not to include any extra information beyond what's necessary for a concise yet accurate summary.
</think>

Roddick will play Cyril Saulnier in the SAP Open finals on Sunday. Roddick defeated Germany's Tommy Haas 7-6 (7-3) 6-3, facing top seeds Andy Roddick and Cyril Saulier. Roddick described his early loss as "furious" but showed resilience through backhandes and points. Despite facing a top-five opponent, he broke Haas twice and secured the win. Saulier won the tie-break and has climbed to world No. 50 after reaching the finals.
tinyllama:1.1b: Robert Roddick will face Cyril Saulnier in the final of the SAAP Open in San Jose, following Saulnier's victory over Tommy Haas, who was struggling earlier in the week. Roddick had to battle his way past Jurgen Melzer in a tie-break before winning the last four points of the first set to lead 4-2 in the second. Despite the frustrations of not converting his chances against top-five players like Haas, Roddick was ultimately able to progress to the final. Saulnier will enter the world's top 50 for the first time after overcoming a sluggish start from Haas to win in four sets and advance to the final.

He won the crucial tie-breaker after breaking Haas at the start of the second set, and took advantage of Roddick's frustrations, breaking him again in the fifth game. Eventually, Roddick emerged victorious in a dramatic match that went down to the wire. Saulnier will take his place among the world's top 50 following his thrilling victory.
